revised_title: Further Researches on the Reaction of Hydrogen Dioxide and Hydrogen Iodide
tldr: The authors investigate the reaction rate of hydrogen dioxide and hydrogen iodide, finding that the amount of change is directly proportional to the amount of dioxide, iodide, time, and total volume of the solution. They also explore the influence of various substances on the reaction rate and present a mathematical equation to describe the relationship between the conditions of a chemical change and its amount.
